results.title: Ladies and Gentlemen, Daniel Craig
results.abstract: At long last, the star of the James Bond franchise bids farewell to 007 with “No Time to Die” (and learns for the first time about his life as an internet meme).

multimedia.caption: “Maybe I’ll be remembered as the Grumpy Bond,” Daniel Craig said. But, he added, “I’m quite satisfied with that.”
multimedia.copyright: Devin Oktar Yalkin for The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Many Saints of Newark’ Review: The Best Really Is Over
results.abstract: In the movie prequel to “The Sopranos,” Tony returns as a child who learns to navigate his families on a difficult road to mob power.

results.title: ‘No Time to Die’ Review: His Word Is His Bond
results.abstract: The 25th episode in the venerable franchise — and Daniel Craig’s last as 007 — finds its hero in a somber mood.

results.title: Jim Jarmusch’s Collages Are Ready for Their Close-Up
results.abstract: The filmmaker has been quietly making small, eerie collages on newsprint for 20 years, with faces switched onto other bodies. Now they’re finally on view.

multimedia.caption: Jim Jarmusch likes removing heads in his tiny collages with newsprint. He’s been making them for 20 years and mostly keeping them to himself —  until now.
multimedia.copyright: Josefina Santos for The New York Times

results.title: Michael Gandolfini and the Riddle of Tony Soprano
results.abstract: In “The Many Saints of Newark,” James Gandolfini’s son takes on his father’s iconic role. But knowing his dad hardly prepared him for the work ahead.

multimedia.caption: Michael Gandolfini in New York. He pursued acting not because of his father but because he was “craving an answer” about whether he’d be good at it.
multimedia.copyright: Devin Oktar Yalkin for The New York Times

results.title: For Al Franken, a Comeback Attempt Goes Through Comedy Clubs
results.abstract: Onstage, the ex-senator and “S.N.L.” star doesn’t exactly address his fall from grace. But he doesn’t not address it either. Asked if he’ll run again, he is noncommittal.

results.title: Done With Bond, Daniel Craig Will Play Macbeth on Broadway
results.abstract: Ruth Negga will co-star as Lady Macbeth in a production directed by Sam Gold and scheduled to open next April.

results.title: A Specialist in Short and Lethal Movie Thrillers Jumps to TV
results.abstract: The French director Julien Leclercq’s action movies are known for their ruthless economy. His new Netflix thriller, “Ganglands,” tests his approach across six episodes.

multimedia.caption: “I think all filmmakers today have fantasies of tackling a series,” said Julien Leclercq, “I’ve watched ‘True Detective’ five times, ‘Breaking Bad’ three times.”
multimedia.copyright: Elliott Verdier for The New York Times

results.title: How Lip-Syncing Got Real
results.abstract: Not long ago, lip-syncing was the domain of subversive drag queens, or pop stars that the media saw as talentless. Now it’s how scrappy amateurs get famous.

results.title: 14 Cuts in 25 Minutes: How Hong Kong Censors Movies
results.abstract: The Asian film capital has cracked down on documentaries and independent productions that it fears could glamorize the pro-democracy movement.
results.byline: By Austin Ramzy and Tiffany May

results.title: Bobby Zarem, ‘Superflack’ and Maker of Stars, Dies at 84
results.abstract: As a spirited impresario of public relations, he promoted entertainers, films and the “I Love New York” tourism campaign.

results.title: Disney Sues to Keep Complete Rights to Marvel Characters

results.title: Comedians Turn Their Attention to Abortion
results.abstract: Alison Leiby has an hourlong set looking at the experience of an unwanted pregnancy. She’s among a spate of female artists finding humor in the issue.

results.title: Roger Michell, Director of ‘Notting Hill,’ Is Dead at 65
results.abstract: He was an accomplished theater director as well as a filmmaker. But he was best known for his blockbuster romantic comedy starring Julia Roberts and Hugh Grant.

multimedia.caption: The director Roger Michell on the set of his film “Enduring Love” in 2004. “I have strong views about the kind of work I want to do,” he once said. “That’s all that guides me.”
The director Roger Michell on the set of his film “Enduring Love” in 2004. “I have strong views about the kind of work I want to do,” he once said. “That’s all that guides me.”

results.title: Camille Cottin, de ‘Dix pour cent’ à Hollywood
results.abstract: Après le succès fulgurant de la série aux USA, la comédienne joue avec Matt Damon dans “Stillwater”, de Tom McCarthy. “Vous ne pouvez quasiment pas la quitter des yeux quand elle est à l’écran,” dit le réalisateur.

multimedia.caption: “Vous me dites que pendant la pandémie, tout le monde regardait “Call My Agent !” J’étais à mille lieues de ça, au contraire, je me sentais enterrée vivante,” dit Camille Cottin.
multimedia.copyright: Tania Franco Klein pour The New York Times

results.title: ‘Stillwater’, l’autre tragédie américaine
results.abstract: Dans le dernier film de Tom McCarthy, le rôle tenu par Matt Damon est sur-travaillé, d’une réserve plombante. Mais l’électrique Camille Cottin donne de la force à son personnage et de la gravité à ses scènes.
